City Council Place 2

Councilmember Grant Holt, Place 2 E-mail: gholt@navasotatx.gov

Phone: (936) 825-6475 Grant is proud of his Texas heritage and is a seventh-generation resident of Grimes County, dating back to when Texas was still a republic. His grandmother was born in Piedmont, but after the death of her father shortly after her birth, Grant’s great-grandmother moved to Houston to provide for the family. As a result, Grant and his four siblings were all born in Houston.

He began delivering newspapers in the third grade and continued through his sophomore year of high school, a fitting job, as his father was on staff at the . In 1972, his parents, Robert and Pat, moved the family to Plantersville. Grant went on to work for two years at Silverstein’s Lucky 7 Grocery Store, which is now home to The Emporium. He was the drum major his senior year at Navasota High School and graduated in 1974.

During a college night event in Brenham, Grant attended a session for the Commonwealth College of Mortuary Science on a whim, and discovered his calling. He graduated from Commonwealth in 1977 and went on to work for Pat H. Foley Funeral Directors, Waltrip Funeral Home, and Geo. H. Lewis & Sons in Houston.

In 1980, Grant made a career change and joined GMAC, where he worked until 1987. During that time, he met his first wife, JoAnn Schrimpf. In December 1987, Grant purchased Lindley-Robertson Funeral Home, and the Lindley-Robertson-Holt Funeral Home was established. He and JoAnn married in October 1989 and worked side by side to manage the business until her passing in February 2013.

Feeling a deep Christian calling, Grant attended St. Mary’s Seminary at St. Thomas University and graduated in 1995 with a degree in Pastoral Theology. He served as a deacon for 27 years at Christ Our Light and St. Stanislaus Kostka Catholic Churches.

In September 2024, Grant married Mary Jane at St. Mary in Plantersville, becoming a cherished part of her family. Mary Jane’s husband had passed in 2022, and together she and Grant found love a second time.

Former member and past president, Grimes St. Joseph Hospital Board Former chairman and past president, St. Joseph Foundation Former member and past president, American Cancer Society – Grimes County Unit Served on the City of Navasota Board of Adjustments for many years prior to City Council election Navasota City Council Member, 2007–2023 Served as Mayor Pro Tem during tenure on City Council Former member and past president, Navasota Kiwanis Club Co-chair, Navasota Nostalgia Days (1989) His former home at 901 Church Street was featured on the Navasota Garden Club Home Tour (2014) Named Navasota Citizen of the Year (2016)

Member, Navasota Grimes County Chamber of Commerce Member, Knights of Columbus Council 9367 – Navasota Board Member, Navasota Theatre Alliance (since 1988) Parishioner, St. Mary’s Catholic Church – Plantersville

(936) 825-6475
media@navasotatx.gov
200 E. McAlpine Street Navasota, TX 77868
Monday-Friday: 8am-5pm
